The plant typically grows in moist or wet habitats, such as marshes, stream banks, and wet meadows. Its flowers are often clustered in dense inflorescences and are visited by various pollinators, including bees and flies. Samolus alyssoides is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity in its native habitats.
